Update pool_id in test_update_vip unit test

Fixes: bug #1157300

The unit test for updating a VIP should test that the pool_id can be
updated. This fix will create a pool and a VIP, update the VIP with
the pool_id, then verify the pool_id was updated.

Change-Id: I8d89b1593def2b7b40c631b25dfd8514c4501065

subject: Fix issues with check_instance_shared_storage.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-10 21:04:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Fix issues with check_instance_shared_storage.

Commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 added a new method to
the compute rpc API.  A test was not added to compute/test_rpcapi.py for
this.  I noticed when I hit a bug in a patch I'm working on that would
have been caught by this test.

The addition to the client side also missed adding the version number
that was required for this method to be supported.

Since the versioning wasn't set up fully, this patch goes ahead and adds
the instance to the data being sent, as well.  It's more consistent,
even if not used (yet).

Fix bug 1167356.

Change-Id: I46055a666fe3cf4a923002f11d22c3b6a6d020e2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with check_instance_shared_storage.

Commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 added a new method to
the compute rpc API.  A test was not added to compute/test_rpcapi.py for
this.  I noticed when I hit a bug in a patch I'm working on that would
have been caught by this test.

The addition to the client side also missed adding the version number
that was required for this method to be supported.

Since the versioning wasn't set up fully, this patch goes ahead and adds
the instance to the data being sent, as well.  It's more consistent,
even if not used (yet).

Fix bug 1167356.

Change-Id: I46055a666fe3cf4a923002f11d22c3b6a6d020e2

commit_message:
Fix kwargs for NECDBException.

Updates the NEC plugin to use the correct kwargs when raising
NECDBException.

commit_message:
Fix backup manager formatting error.

ID was being printed as %d instead of %s, causing tests to fail. This
error was previously undetected.
In addition, NetApp tests are failing due to a bug in the suds
package, which is no longer actively maintained. This patch adds skips
to the problematic tests, which should be removed once the issue is
resolved.

Change-Id: I5645909f59aa2ea3dc536ed4707ea75754307050
Fixes: bug 1166600
(cherry picked from commit 23bd028ce39bebf0f5d2403df328ad55e6eb007e)

subject: Clean up attach/detach tests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-08 09:25:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Clean up attach/detach tests.

The code tested by test_preattach_status_volume was moved, and the
test no longer tested anything relevant (i.e., instead of checking
that the volume is 'attached', the test was changed to test for
'available' since the attach code was moved). This patch, therefore,
deletes that test.

Further, test_run_attach_detach_volume called database functions for
attaching and detaching. This patch changes those calls to call
higher-level functions which in turn call the database functions. This
gives better code coverage and gives the tests more meaning.

Change-Id: If688fe6a14940148b5792256c8507803e8cde901
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up attach/detach tests.

The code tested by test_preattach_status_volume was moved, and the
test no longer tested anything relevant (i.e., instead of checking
that the volume is 'attached', the test was changed to test for
'available' since the attach code was moved). This patch, therefore,
deletes that test.

Further, test_run_attach_detach_volume called database functions for
attaching and detaching. This patch changes those calls to call
higher-level functions which in turn call the database functions. This
gives better code coverage and gives the tests more meaning.

Change-Id: If688fe6a14940148b5792256c8507803e8cde901

subject: RHEL6 core support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6473, 'name': 'Sunil Thaha', 'email': 'sthaha@redhat.com', 'username': 'sthaha'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-04-08 04:50:10.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms-rhel6/general', 'files/rpms-rhel6/sysstat', 'files/rpms-rhel6/glance', 'files/rpms-rhel6/n-novnc', 'functions', 'lib/nova', 'tools/rhel6/post-prereq.sh', 'files/rpms-rhel6/horizon', 'files/rpms-rhel6/ldap', 'files/rpms-rhel6/ryu', 'files/rpms-rhel6/postgresql', 'files/rpms-rhel6/n-cpu', 'files/rpms-rhel6/quantum', 'lib/rpc_backend', 'files/rpms-rhel6/n-spice', 'files/rpms-rhel6/ceilometer-collector', 'files/rpms-rhel6/cinder', 'files/rpms-rhel6/nova', 'files/rpms-rhel6/n-api', 'files/rpms-rhel6/swift', 'files/rpms-rhel6/keystone', 'lib/horizon', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * pre-install dbus to avoid the service not having ever been started
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for
   the very minimal usage by lesscss.

 - By default RHEL6 qpidd ships with authentication on, which causes
   Kerberos errors; override this

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
"}]
commit_message:
RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * pre-install dbus to avoid the service not having ever been started
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for
   the very minimal usage by lesscss.

 - By default RHEL6 qpidd ships with authentication on, which causes
   Kerberos errors; override this

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5

This is implemented by reusing the existing code written
for volume_create_get_delete; that function has been renamed
and has support for an the parameter 'image_ref'. The pre-existing
volume_create_get_delete as also the new volume_from_image call
the now renamed old function.

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-04-10 20:12:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/api.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Optimize some of compute/manager's periodic tasks' DB queries

Most of these tasks do not need to fetch instances with a full
complement of metadata items. Make them say "no thanks" to the DB API
to reduce the amount of work that needs to be done. Note some
refactoring was done in the _get_instance_nw_info() method to pull
this information if it ended up being necessary. The cases where this
would happen are error-cleanup scenarios, and thus taking the extra
hit in that case is an overall win for not having to do it all the
time.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ic7d6290c0b7edf84cbf8bdc64e29f206619f97e5
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize some of compute/manager's periodic tasks' DB queries

Most of these tasks do not need to fetch instances with a full
complement of metadata items. Make them say "no thanks" to the DB API
to reduce the amount of work that needs to be done. Note some
refactoring was done in the _get_instance_nw_info() method to pull
this information if it ended up being necessary. The cases where this
would happen are error-cleanup scenarios, and thus taking the extra
hit in that case is an overall win for not having to do it all the
time.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ic7d6290c0b7edf84cbf8bdc64e29f206619f97e5

subject: glance-manage should not require glance-registry.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-03 20:28:02.000000000', 'files': ['bin/glance-manage'], 'message': 'glance-manage should not require glance-registry.conf

In v2 the glance-registry service is no longer needed.  Thus
it is possible that a setup would not include a configuration
file for it at all.  Further it is possible that glance-api and
glance-registry be run on different machines such that neither
configuration file is available to the other.  Therefore glance-manage
should be able to pull the information out of either configuration
file provided that the overriding command line options:
--sql_connection or --config-file are not used.  This patch makes
it so glance-manage will first look in the glance-registry.conf file
for db information (as this is the legacy behavior) and then in
the glance-api.conf file if that file does not exist.

Fixes bug: 1046576
Change-Id: Ida68a5c03eb3d188b2b997296cd45730b968ef12
'}]
commit_message:
glance-manage should not require glance-registry.conf

In v2 the glance-registry service is no longer needed.  Thus
it is possible that a setup would not include a configuration
file for it at all.  Further it is possible that glance-api and
glance-registry be run on different machines such that neither
configuration file is available to the other.  Therefore glance-manage
should be able to pull the information out of either configuration
file provided that the overriding command line options:
--sql_connection or --config-file are not used.  This patch makes
it so glance-manage will first look in the glance-registry.conf file
for db information (as this is the legacy behavior) and then in
the glance-api.conf file if that file does not exist.

Fixes bug: 1046576
Change-Id: Ida68a5c03eb3d188b2b997296cd45730b968ef12

subject: Don't hide stacktraces for unexpected errors in rescue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-10 21:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/rescue.py', 'nova/api/openstack/extensions.py'], 'message': "Don't hide stacktraces for unexpected errors in rescue

Prevent rescue commands from hiding stacktraces for unexpected errors.
Before this the wrap_errors function would catch unexpected errors and
hide them, with a generic HTTPInternalServerError without any
stacktrace.

Change-Id: I80e0ae8257117a3e5a4c946b38870aad0e58cc12
"}]
commit_message:
Don't hide stacktraces for unexpected errors in rescue

Prevent rescue commands from hiding stacktraces for unexpected errors.
Before this the wrap_errors function would catch unexpected errors and
hide them, with a generic HTTPInternalServerError without any
stacktrace.

Change-Id: I80e0ae8257117a3e5a4c946b38870aad0e58cc12

commit_message:
Optimize some of the periodic task database queries in n-cpu

There are a few trivial periodic tasks that can benefit from telling
the DB API (via conductor) not to fetch metadata items. This patch
makes those changes

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: I8e2730d3ed74bd7e0a0217647316c1cf492f22f3

This makes the DB API for instance_get_all() variants able to take a
columns_to_join parameter like the base instance_get_all() function,
which provides control over whether we go to the trouble of pulling
the metadata out of the database before we return the instances.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ie7c012e2e12bb91ef4294cdc90d828af255b67c5
'}]
commit_message:
Change DB API instance functions for selective metadata fetching

This makes the DB API for instance_get_all() variants able to take a
columns_to_join parameter like the base instance_get_all() function,
which provides control over whether we go to the trouble of pulling
the metadata out of the database before we return the instances.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ie7c012e2e12bb91ef4294cdc90d828af255b67c5

subject: Cache metadata in /var/cache instead of /tmp
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-10 22:14:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat_cfntools/cfntools/cfn_helper.py', 'heat_cfntools/tests/test_cfn_helper.py'], 'message': 'Cache metadata in /var/cache instead of /tmp

/tmp is unsafe if a user were to somehow be able to create the file
before it was cached there they can issue commands to cfn-init that
would likely elevate their permissions.

Fixes bug #1164756

Change-Id: I54e1e1be178274cb0a2b50f54e859e004e1f1c78
'}]
commit_message:
Cache metadata in /var/cache instead of /tmp

/tmp is unsafe if a user were to somehow be able to create the file
before it was cached there they can issue commands to cfn-init that
would likely elevate their permissions.

Fixes bug #1164756

Change-Id: I54e1e1be178274cb0a2b50f54e859e004e1f1c78

subject: Use tempfile.mkdtemp to avoid tempfile race
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-10 22:10:13.000000000', 'files': ['heat_cfntools/cfntools/cfn_helper.py', 'heat_cfntools/tests/test_cfn_helper.py'], 'message': 'Use tempfile.mkdtemp to avoid tempfile race

Malicious users could predict these tempfile names and overwrite root
owned files using a symlink attack.

Also fixes a bug in order of operations which caused tar to fail if
the destination directory did not exist yet.

Fixes bug #1166323

Change-Id: Ib4040eed27aa7e1e4d2bf53df6cae8e2b6c95f50
'}]
commit_message:
Use tempfile.mkdtemp to avoid tempfile race

Malicious users could predict these tempfile names and overwrite root
owned files using a symlink attack.

Also fixes a bug in order of operations which caused tar to fail if
the destination directory did not exist yet.

Fixes bug #1166323

Change-Id: Ib4040eed27aa7e1e4d2bf53df6cae8e2b6c95f50

commit_message:
Parallelize quantum unit testing:

This change switches run_tests.sh to use testr
in parallel mode, instead of nosetests, in order
to enable unit tests to run in parallel.

By default, the number of parallel test processes
is set to the number of cores on the test machine.

A similar change was recently merged to nova:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15078/

Some tests required updating to remove inter-testcase
dependencies.

bug #1099694

Change-Id: Idfb923d424342a07dcba88d70b971683f549f763

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-04-10 19:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Replace metadata joins with another query

Right now, we always join metadata and system_metadata when we query for
instances. This inflates the number of rows returned by a factor of ten
at a minimum, and over 30 in some situations. This patch avoids the
direct join of these tables in favor of a "manual join" which performs
additional queries to fill the needed data. Latency may be increased,
but with the gain of a potentially significant amount of reduction in
data transfer.

This also provides the ability for the queries which utilize it to
selectively decide whether either or both of these additional fills are
performed, paving the way for future high-level optimizations.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9
'}]
commit_message:
Replace metadata joins with another query

Right now, we always join metadata and system_metadata when we query for
instances. This inflates the number of rows returned by a factor of ten
at a minimum, and over 30 in some situations. This patch avoids the
direct join of these tables in favor of a "manual join" which performs
additional queries to fill the needed data. Latency may be increased,
but with the gain of a potentially significant amount of reduction in
data transfer.

This also provides the ability for the queries which utilize it to
selectively decide whether either or both of these additional fills are
performed, paving the way for future high-level optimizations.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9

subject: baremetal: Integrate provisioning and non-provisioning interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-04-04 10:10:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/baremetal/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/006_move_prov_mac_address.py', 'nova/tests/baremetal/test_pxe.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/pxe.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/tilera.py', 'nova/tests/test_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/baremetal/test_tilera.py'], 'message': "baremetal: Integrate provisioning and non-provisioning interfaces

Originally, baremetal pxe/tilera driver managed two types of network
interfaces in two tables; provisioning interfaces in bm_nodes table
and non-provisioning (normal) interfaces in bm_interfaces table.
But, now actually both types are handled in the same way and there is
no difference between them except for which table they are in.

This patch moves the provisioning interfaces to bm_interfaces. However
it does not drop prov_mac_address in bm_nodes since VirtualPowerManager
still uses it to identify a target in a list of VMs returned by the
VM's host.

Change-Id: I5ce940e7127aa3b29ba7802612938dc5dbc3152f
"}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Integrate provisioning and non-provisioning interfaces

Originally, baremetal pxe/tilera driver managed two types of network
interfaces in two tables; provisioning interfaces in bm_nodes table
and non-provisioning (normal) interfaces in bm_interfaces table.
But, now actually both types are handled in the same way and there is
no difference between them except for which table they are in.

This patch moves the provisioning interfaces to bm_interfaces. However
it does not drop prov_mac_address in bm_nodes since VirtualPowerManager
still uses it to identify a target in a list of VMs returned by the
VM's host.

Change-Id: I5ce940e7127aa3b29ba7802612938dc5dbc3152f

commit_message:
Fix error message in pre_live_migration.

We are using locals() to reference a variable which doesn't exist
in this error message. Also rename the instance variable while I
am here to be more consistent with other uses.

Resolves bug 1164072.

Change-Id: I96f5e2a81ac2e97181c3e87df83e19b381f4bcd2

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-04-10 11:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'doc/manpages/proxy-server.conf.5', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_except.py', 'swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'message': 'Adding a new optional variable called trans_id_suffix

The trans_id_suffix (default is empty) would be appended to the swift transaction
id allowing one to easily figure out from which cluster that X-Trans-Id
belongs to. This is very useful when one is managing more than one swift
cluster. Also updated sample and manpage to reflect the changes.

Change-Id: Icdf63643e9c1bde36a9ef5e3f41ee9fb20e55f5d
'}]
commit_message:
Adding a new optional variable called trans_id_suffix

The trans_id_suffix (default is empty) would be appended to the swift transaction
id allowing one to easily figure out from which cluster that X-Trans-Id
belongs to. This is very useful when one is managing more than one swift
cluster. Also updated sample and manpage to reflect the changes.

Change-Id: Icdf63643e9c1bde36a9ef5e3f41ee9fb20e55f5d

subject: Improved mongodb's storage queries and indexes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-10 14:46:50.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/storage/mongodb/utils.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/controllers.py', 'marconi/tests/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': "Improved mongodb's storage queries and indexes

The patch reduces the number of indexes needed and changes how data is
stored.

Major changes:
    * Messages expire now contains claim's expire for messages whos
    expiration time is less than claims.
    * New messages now contain a fake claim object that allows the
    driver for querying using that field even when the message hasn't
    been claimed. (see `active`)

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

Change-Id: Ia932d15fb3a3e0e7c50d667fae330cb031e34a8a
"}]
commit_message:
Improved mongodb's storage queries and indexes

The patch reduces the number of indexes needed and changes how data is
stored.

Major changes:
    * Messages expire now contains claim's expire for messages whos
    expiration time is less than claims.
    * New messages now contain a fake claim object that allows the
    driver for querying using that field even when the message hasn't
    been claimed. (see `active`)

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

Change-Id: Ia932d15fb3a3e0e7c50d667fae330cb031e34a8a

subject: 3PAR Block Storage Driver space character issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-10 17:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/openstack-block-storage-admin/drivers/hp-3par-driver.xml'], 'message': '3PAR Block Storage Driver space character issues

The Block Storage Admin Guide PDF in the HP 3PAR Fibre Channel
and iSCSI driver section could add a few spaces to improve readability
in the Supported Operations section. This fixes the following few lines:

provisioning - Defaults to thin provisioning, the valid values are thinand full.
<need to add a space character after thin and before and>

persona - Defaults to the 1 – Genericpersona.
<need to add a space between Generic and persona>

Change-Id: I7278ea2c4ba43003ccce4fcf43bc233b3b2760c3
Fixes: bug 1167468
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR Block Storage Driver space character issues

The Block Storage Admin Guide PDF in the HP 3PAR Fibre Channel
and iSCSI driver section could add a few spaces to improve readability
in the Supported Operations section. This fixes the following few lines:

provisioning - Defaults to thin provisioning, the valid values are thinand full.
<need to add a space character after thin and before and>

persona - Defaults to the 1 – Genericpersona.
<need to add a space between Generic and persona>

Change-Id: I7278ea2c4ba43003ccce4fcf43bc233b3b2760c3
Fixes: bug 1167468

subject: Clarify volume related exception message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-10 00:03:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': 'Clarify volume related exception message

Before the message was "status must be available," which could either mean
nova couldn't fetch the status or the status was not set to 'available'. As
this message means the latter, make it more explicit by putting available in
quotes.

Change-Id: I1b167073463c781569919926fa9b8960f4fecf59
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify volume related exception message

Before the message was "status must be available," which could either mean
nova couldn't fetch the status or the status was not set to 'available'. As
this message means the latter, make it more explicit by putting available in
quotes.

Change-Id: I1b167073463c781569919926fa9b8960f4fecf59

commit_message:
Simplify random host choice.

The random Python module provides a handy funcion for choosing a random
element from a sequence.  Use that instead of a more manual method of
accomplishing the same thing.

Change-Id: I1908bd5e79b6c21d0dcf7e540143e9b8de478d24

commit_message:
Fix backup manager formatting error.

ID was being printed as %d instead of %s, causing tests to fail. This
error was previously undetected.
In addition, NetApp tests are failing due to a bug in the suds
package, which is no longer actively maintained. This patch adds skips
to the problematic tests, which should be removed once the issue is
resolved.

Change-Id: I5645909f59aa2ea3dc536ed4707ea75754307050
Fixes: bug 1166600

Remove an invalid trove classifier.

prevents successful upload of the package when present.

commit_message:
The parameter of some APIs are not full list.

In current API doc, the parameter is not full list for bellow API:
1.POST v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments,
  in current document, there are 2 parameter in Parameter part:
  "tenant-id" and "server id". But it should include
  "volumeAttachment", "volumeId","device"
2.POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks Create a network,
  only list tenant_id in Parameter part
3. No Request Sample in POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks.

Fix bug 1158616

Change-Id: I66f0e29d186ea8f1bdf6a23d3cc9c0ca72db974e

commit_message:
Add common filter/filter handler for filter scheduler

Filter scheduler is being used for more than one core projects (Nova
and Cinder as of writing), the implementation shared a lot of common
code.  This patch moves base filter/filter handler class as well as
common filter implementation for filter scheduler into oslo to reduce
possible porting.

implement bp: common-filters

Change-Id: If0b1dee79c410c98e152230b55c1ec5dbcdef27c

This patch changes the MongoDB driver so that it will use
MongoReplicaSetClient instead of MongoClient when a
replicaSet is specified in the connection URI. Testing

Change-Id: I3c1a2a166c5dd2c857cd52a2d1766437a9e4a940
'}]
commit_message:
fix: Enable reading from secondaries in the MongoDB driver.

This patch changes the MongoDB driver so that it will use
MongoReplicaSetClient instead of MongoClient when a
replicaSet is specified in the connection URI. Testing
revealed that this is necessary for readPreference to be
respected.

Change-Id: I3c1a2a166c5dd2c857cd52a2d1766437a9e4a940

commit_message:
Require cinder package before running sync.

Updates the cinder::api module so that we install the Cinder
package before running the 'cinder-manage db sync' command.

This fixes issues where the db sync can fail (because
the binary and user are missing, etc.)

Change-Id: Ida1da688d08a673ca8673bea263fb0925fbbcc49

subject: raise the first exception in flavors and security_group test
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-04-09 20:29:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/compute/admin/test_flavors.py', 'tempest/tests/compute/security_groups/test_security_group_rules.py', 'tempest/tests/compute/security_groups/test_security_groups.py'], 'message': 'raise the first exception in flavors and security_group test

The exceptions raised in the finally block hides the exceptions raised
in the try block.

For example if a resource creation fails you would see the exception from the
resource deletion.

This change replaces the finally usage by addCleanup methods.

test_security_group_rules_create_delete removed because of a duplication.

Change-Id: Id69a3b7edd0933f4d5967bd8b84fb16a2095ab0a
'}]
commit_message:
raise the first exception in flavors and security_group test

The exceptions raised in the finally block hides the exceptions raised
in the try block.

For example if a resource creation fails you would see the exception from the
resource deletion.

This change replaces the finally usage by addCleanup methods.

test_security_group_rules_create_delete removed because of a duplication.

Change-Id: Id69a3b7edd0933f4d5967bd8b84fb16a2095ab0a

subject: Remove smoke.py and clean up base test classes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-09 19:26:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/network/common.py', 'tempest/smoke.py', 'tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_server_advanced_ops.py', 'tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_server_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': "Remove smoke.py and clean up base test classes

This commit removes the smoke.py file and reworks the classes in
test.py to be a bit simpler. Previously, DefaultClientTest
was only really needed by smoke.py for the smoke tests. (the only
place where python clients were used) However, it remained a separate
class because of the status_timeout() method. This breaks out that
method and removes the class so that it is more obvious that the
smoke tests are using tempest.manager for it's clients.

Change-Id: Ib4333483c5734d14cac6376837ca770e96bd050e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove smoke.py and clean up base test classes

This commit removes the smoke.py file and reworks the classes in
test.py to be a bit simpler. Previously, DefaultClientTest
was only really needed by smoke.py for the smoke tests. (the only
place where python clients were used) However, it remained a separate
class because of the status_timeout() method. This breaks out that
method and removes the class so that it is more obvious that the
smoke tests are using tempest.manager for it's clients.

Change-Id: Ib4333483c5734d14cac6376837ca770e96bd050e

subject: plugin/nec: Ensure ID on PFC is up to 31 chars
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-10 11:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/nec/drivers/pfc.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/nec/test_pfc_driver.py'], 'message': 'plugin/nec: Ensure ID on PFC is up to 31 chars

Some version of NEC ProgrammableFlow OpenFlow controller, one of
the OpenFlow controllers (OFCs), accepts the string up to 31 chars
as a network ID. NEC plugin now uses Quantum UUID as ID on OFC,
so this leads to failure on network creation. This commit changes
the plugin to generate a 31-char ID on OFC to keep its uniqueness.
The same thing can be said to port ID.

Similarly, the description field must be a string up to 127 chars
and consist of [A-Za-z0-9_] characters. This change also fixes it.

Bug #1166077

Change-Id: I0a879f5158a6ac0ce332e3698d42dd38d4283a60
'}]
commit_message:
plugin/nec: Ensure ID on PFC is up to 31 chars

Some version of NEC ProgrammableFlow OpenFlow controller, one of
the OpenFlow controllers (OFCs), accepts the string up to 31 chars
as a network ID. NEC plugin now uses Quantum UUID as ID on OFC,
so this leads to failure on network creation. This commit changes
the plugin to generate a 31-char ID on OFC to keep its uniqueness.
The same thing can be said to port ID.

Similarly, the description field must be a string up to 127 chars
and consist of [A-Za-z0-9_] characters. This change also fixes it.

Bug #1166077

Change-Id: I0a879f5158a6ac0ce332e3698d42dd38d4283a60

Migrate overridable environment variables to DIB_ namespace.

Anywhere we have an environment variable that can be overridden at
build time, is now migrated to have DIB_ in front of its name. This
will allow future work to scrub the build environment clean of any
variables that do not belong in the build.

subject: Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-10 10:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/midonet/test_midonet_plugin.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e
'}]
commit_message:
Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e

commit_message:
Fix Makefile for XenServer builds

The provided Makefile failed to build the agent rpm for XenServer, using
the 6.1 ddk:
- version info was using only python instead of python2.6
- Failed to retrieve version info - bad paths
- Non unattended yum instruction - added -qy
- unpackaged files (pyc, pyo) halted the build. - added defines

Change-Id: I405aafe5df8a5955cb9f23bcca34037d557bae63

subject: plugin/nec: Make sure resources on OFC is globally unique.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-10 08:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/plugins/nec/drivers/pfc.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/nec/test_pfc_driver.py'], 'message': 'plugin/nec: Make sure resources on OFC is globally unique.

V3 and V4 of NEC ProgrammableFlow controller (PFC) generates a network ID
unique inside a tenant. On the other hand, ID mapping table in NEC plugin
expects ID on OFC is globally unique. As a result creation of a network
will fail. To fix it, quantum network ID is passed as ID on OFC.
The same issue happens in port creation too.

In Grizzly this bug was fixed in another way (to support shared network),
but this change is quite big and it cannot be backported.
The minimum way to fix this bug is to specify OFC network ID from Quantum.

Since V3 of PFC does not return network/port ID in the response when ID is
passed in the request, create_network/port is changed to return an ID
passed to the controller instead of extracting ID from the response.

Fixes bug #1127664

Change-Id: Iad1961ee2469b547598e87e63a4a3dc4ac9c6e97
'}]
commit_message:
plugin/nec: Make sure resources on OFC is globally unique.

V3 and V4 of NEC ProgrammableFlow controller (PFC) generates a network ID
unique inside a tenant. On the other hand, ID mapping table in NEC plugin
expects ID on OFC is globally unique. As a result creation of a network
will fail. To fix it, quantum network ID is passed as ID on OFC.
The same issue happens in port creation too.

In Grizzly this bug was fixed in another way (to support shared network),
but this change is quite big and it cannot be backported.
The minimum way to fix this bug is to specify OFC network ID from Quantum.

Since V3 of PFC does not return network/port ID in the response when ID is
passed in the request, create_network/port is changed to return an ID
passed to the controller instead of extracting ID from the response.

Fixes bug #1127664

Change-Id: Iad1961ee2469b547598e87e63a4a3dc4ac9c6e97

commit_message:
Adding a running method to the Backup Model

* Adds a query classmethod to Base Model for
  more complex queries such 'in_'
* Adds a running classmethod to Backup Model
  which returns any currently running backups
  for an instance.
* Add a checksum field to the Backup Model.
* Refactor the DBBackup to reuse base methods

Change-Id: Iaf6903af88c7f4caa20921f1ca63354999ec6348

commit_message:
Allow pdb debugging in manually-invoked tests.

 * The old behavior required setting environment variables to
   disable capture of stdout and stderr to allow debugging via pdb.
   The new behavior requires enabling capture of stdout/stderr
   instead. This is already the case in nova.
 * testr behavior is unmodified.
 * Tip 'o the hat to Robert Collins (lifeless)

Change-Id: Ica021eeab07d5a540ce42436c9cc8000c3fd239a

subject: Enable admin to associate network with any project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-01 13:05:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_networks.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/os_networks.py'], 'message': "Enable admin to associate network with any project

Current api extension networks only can add network to admin his own project,
because it get project_id from context.project_id, which is filled by keystone
according to the token. So this fix extracts project_id from the request body,
along with the network id. And if the project_id is not provided in the body,
it will use context.project_id. This fix doesn't change the old behaviour,
neither the request url format, but can provide the convenient way to associate network to any project.

Change-Id: I9e8aeb5ef84a1a5c053555bf0cc974f4b8b3d7f3
Fixes: Bug #1161441
"}]
commit_message:
Enable admin to associate network with any project

Current api extension networks only can add network to admin his own project,
because it get project_id from context.project_id, which is filled by keystone
according to the token. So this fix extracts project_id from the request body,
along with the network id. And if the project_id is not provided in the body,
it will use context.project_id. This fix doesn't change the old behaviour,
neither the request url format, but can provide the convenient way to associate network to any project.

Change-Id: I9e8aeb5ef84a1a5c053555bf0cc974f4b8b3d7f3
Fixes: Bug #1161441

subject: Read from multiple metadata sources.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-10 01:16:16.000000000', 'files': ['os_config_applier/util.py', 'os_config_applier/os_config_applier.py', 'os_config_applier/tests/test_os_config_applier.py', 'os_config_applier/tests/test_util.py'], 'message': 'Read from multiple metadata sources.

Heat writes the initial metadata for a server to
/var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data. heat-cfntools will read remote
metadata and if it is updated, copy it to /tmp/last_metadata. So we need
to read from that location first, and then the initial static location.

Because this file is in /tmp, special care is taken to make sure we are
only reading from files that are writable by whoever we are running as,
or root (usually that will be the same two users).

Change-Id: Ida17453c88a2ac400367283f2fb6871a1a0a544f
'}]
commit_message:
Read from multiple metadata sources.

Heat writes the initial metadata for a server to
/var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data. heat-cfntools will read remote
metadata and if it is updated, copy it to /tmp/last_metadata. So we need
to read from that location first, and then the initial static location.

Because this file is in /tmp, special care is taken to make sure we are
only reading from files that are writable by whoever we are running as,
or root (usually that will be the same two users).

Change-Id: Ida17453c88a2ac400367283f2fb6871a1a0a544f

commit_message:
Populate default SG rules through plugin methods

SG rules that are created upon SG creation be created
directly through DB models. Therefore, the plugin
wouldn't have a chance to handle the rules. This patch fixes it.

Fixes bug 1156504

Change-Id: I01d6f27f42d2d19ddb0835f71547e5103aecd94f

subject: Run 'keystone db_sync' as keystone user.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-04-10 00:10:32.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Run 'keystone db_sync' as keystone user.

Running db_sync as root can cause permissions issues due to the fact
that the keystone log file gets owned as root
(/var/log/keystone/keystone.log).

This makes this module usable when using packages on Fedora 18.

Change-Id: I2c75db61474fb14f898c530bec2e8aad1230ad7c
"}]
commit_message:
Run 'keystone db_sync' as keystone user.

Running db_sync as root can cause permissions issues due to the fact
that the keystone log file gets owned as root
(/var/log/keystone/keystone.log).

This makes this module usable when using packages on Fedora 18.

Change-Id: I2c75db61474fb14f898c530bec2e8aad1230ad7c

commit_message:
objects md5-collisions

This patch identifies md5 collisions on objects and sends a 403
from the object server.

Credits for originating this fix are to Michael Factor.

Change-Id: I4f1b32183e2be6bbea56eaff86b9a4c7f440804a
Fix: Bug #1157454

subject: Make swift backend not enherit glance::api.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-04 22:28:53.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/backend/swift.pp'], 'message': 'Make swift backend not enherit glance::api.

Having the glance::backend::swift class inherit glance::api
makes it unusable (it causes puppet errors due to missing password
which is required by glance::api).

Since this module is mainly just useful to configure sets of
swift configs it can stand on its own.

Change-Id: I549087e2e9e9e1abd43bd0f78e4f4dee71490ace
'}]
commit_message:
Make swift backend not enherit glance::api.

Having the glance::backend::swift class inherit glance::api
makes it unusable (it causes puppet errors due to missing password
which is required by glance::api).

Since this module is mainly just useful to configure sets of
swift configs it can stand on its own.

Change-Id: I549087e2e9e9e1abd43bd0f78e4f4dee71490ace

commit_message:
Adding help text to the options that did not have it.

Many of the config options did not have help text set.  This patch
adds text for those.

patchset2 adds 5 skipped options

patchset3 adds a missing underscore before the helptext bracket

patchset4 fixes pep8 errors

patchset5 notes the units (seconds) in sql_retry_interval, as noted
by Flavio Percoco Premoli

patchset6 fixes comments from Alex Meade

Fixes bug: 1162449
Change-Id: Ic75e499456e389df2ec527594bbcd54c0b464ee3

subject: Generate ssh hostkeys on first-boot.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-09 20:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ubuntu/first-boot.d/01-ssh'], 'message': "Generate ssh hostkeys on first-boot.

cloud-init is expected to generate unique hostkeys on first
boot, but sometimes it doesn't.

This change ensures that hostkeys are always generated.
This change should be removed if the cloud-init problem is solved.

Change-Id: I7d7e05fbd12727992cf1aebec547ae0488e002ff
"}]
commit_message:
Generate ssh hostkeys on first-boot.

cloud-init is expected to generate unique hostkeys on first
boot, but sometimes it doesn't.

This change ensures that hostkeys are always generated.
This change should be removed if the cloud-init problem is solved.

Change-Id: I7d7e05fbd12727992cf1aebec547ae0488e002ff

subject: Add armhf support.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-09 20:53:28.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'elements/base/install.d/00-baseline-environment', 'elements/fedora/bin/install-packages', 'elements/base/install.d/99-up-to-date', 'README.md', 'elements/dpkg/bin/install-packages'], 'message': "Add armhf support.

ARM doesn't have a generic Linux image due to the soc-specific nature of Linux
kernels today, so we drop the manual installation of that package, replacing it
with a dist-upgrade instead. This involved tweaks to the dpkg and fedora
install-package scripts.

Change-Id: I97924b80ca87781307e1087b9fe4b18215770e84
"}]
commit_message:
Add armhf support.

ARM doesn't have a generic Linux image due to the soc-specific nature of Linux
kernels today, so we drop the manual installation of that package, replacing it
with a dist-upgrade instead. This involved tweaks to the dpkg and fedora
install-package scripts.

Change-Id: I97924b80ca87781307e1087b9fe4b18215770e84

commit_message:
Add Swift Static Large Objects to admin guide

Grizzly brings a new feature to swift - the ability to upload
large objects broken into chunks, unified by a manifest file.
This patch copies the doc from the swift code into the admin
manual.

fixes bug 1153469

Change-Id: Ib3cd45d9d3e2dd8ddd151a5a1acde14639af4b83

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-09 13:03:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/manager.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Catch NoValidHost exception during live-migration

To avoid leaving the instance state as MIGRATING if scheduling of
a target host fails, add this exception to the list of exceptions
for which the instance task state is reset to None.

Resolves bug 1166771.

Change-Id: I23343091725051624c0eb0b82e9f03a7f9d5f4f4
'}]
commit_message:
Catch NoValidHost exception during live-migration

To avoid leaving the instance state as MIGRATING if scheduling of
a target host fails, add this exception to the list of exceptions
for which the instance task state is reset to None.

Resolves bug 1166771.

Change-Id: I23343091725051624c0eb0b82e9f03a7f9d5f4f4

commit_message:
A self-contained one-node baremetal openstack.

The 'boot-stack' element is a self-contained, baremetal openstack.
Upon first boot, it will initialize itself with default keystone
users, nova flavors, etc.

commit_message:
Add TLS Support for LDAP

Fixes Bug1040115

added several test cases, also provides a full ldap
regression suite. Also added supplemental (simple)
verification for CACERTFILE and CACERTDIR
added a TLS disable option when ldaps URLs are used
and did full regression tests using ldaps URLs
and with TLS
addresses ayoung's comments
addresses dolphm's and Mouad's comments
addresses gyee's doc request and bknudson's comments

Change-Id: I639f2853df0ce5c10ae85b06214b26430d872aca

commit_message:
NetApp: dont allow volume from snapshots of different size

This patch disallows creation of volume from snapshot of
different size. Previously, it seemingly allowed creation of a volume
from snapshot of different size, but in fact, created the volume
of the same size as that of the snapshot

Fixes bug 1164473

Change-Id: Id35175d23baf5f5f19db4fe3968a96f980fcaa65

subject: Fix a bad tearDown method in test_quantumv2.py.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-09 00:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_quantumv2.py'], 'message': "Fix a bad tearDown method in test_quantumv2.py.

Cleanup code runs in LIFO order, so this was calling the mox methods
in the wrong order. Secondly the whole point of addCleanup is to
register code to run as soon as it is known that it should run, vs
tearDown which only runs if setUp succeeds, and doesn't know what
other code completed.

Change-Id: Iff3b91e9d43cc58b667b32cacc4b97b6e0e1f298
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a bad tearDown method in test_quantumv2.py.

Cleanup code runs in LIFO order, so this was calling the mox methods
in the wrong order. Secondly the whole point of addCleanup is to
register code to run as soon as it is known that it should run, vs
tearDown which only runs if setUp succeeds, and doesn't know what
other code completed.

Change-Id: Iff3b91e9d43cc58b667b32cacc4b97b6e0e1f298

subject: Security groups may be unavailable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-09 13:44:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/security_group/quantum_driver.py'], 'message': "Security groups may be unavailable

Currently all missing security group situations are reported as errors
and exceptions. This is not the case - any user requesting a wrong id
or name can cause it and it's not an issue in Nova. A busy system can
generate a large number of those messages causing unnecessarily high
error count.

This change stops reporting this situation as exception in the logs.

Change-Id: Ide856cbbde2db025b0e2def79652cc6c9b00566b
"}]
commit_message:
Security groups may be unavailable

Currently all missing security group situations are reported as errors
and exceptions. This is not the case - any user requesting a wrong id
or name can cause it and it's not an issue in Nova. A busy system can
generate a large number of those messages causing unnecessarily high
error count.

This change stops reporting this situation as exception in the logs.

Change-Id: Ide856cbbde2db025b0e2def79652cc6c9b00566b

subject: Linux Mint support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-09 04:56:25.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': 'Linux Mint support

This patch allows DevStack installation on Linux Mint. Installations
on Linux Mint previously failed since its distribution ID did not
match any of the package installation methods and defaulted to using
rpm packages. Linux Mint is a Ubuntu derivative and such does not have
native support for rpm packages.

This change adds "LinuxMint" to the distribution matching options along
with Debian and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ice6a201cabe07373a9c1354699777835addeac53
Fixes: bug #1166422
'}]
commit_message:
Linux Mint support

This patch allows DevStack installation on Linux Mint. Installations
on Linux Mint previously failed since its distribution ID did not
match any of the package installation methods and defaulted to using
rpm packages. Linux Mint is a Ubuntu derivative and such does not have
native support for rpm packages.

This change adds "LinuxMint" to the distribution matching options along
with Debian and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ice6a201cabe07373a9c1354699777835addeac53
Fixes: bug #1166422

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-09 08:46:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/swift'], 'message': 'Set swift3 before s3token in proxy server middleware pipeline

swift3 and s3token middlewares were not set in correct order in
/etc/swift/proxy-server.conf when the swift3 service is enabled
with keystone. swift3 must be set before s3token.

Fixes: bug #1166123
Change-Id: I97c051af95cbdc26ccfe9753c5719394e1875dde

commit_message:
Set swift3 before s3token in proxy server middleware pipeline

swift3 and s3token middlewares were not set in correct order in
/etc/swift/proxy-server.conf when the swift3 service is enabled
with keystone. swift3 must be set before s3token.

Fixes: bug #1166123
Change-Id: I97c051af95cbdc26ccfe9753c5719394e1875dde

revisions:

If we are using the raw backend (no cow), we should set the driver
type based on the type of the source image instead of always
using raw.

Calls to to_xml were moved after _create_image so that the image

commit_message:
libvirt: Get driver type from base image type.

If we are using the raw backend (no cow), we should set the driver
type based on the type of the source image instead of always
using raw.

Calls to to_xml were moved after _create_image so that the image
type could be determined when creating the xml for libvirt.

Fixes bug 1163009

Change-Id: Ic8d5f0ab83d868a42f834d39c0afb64818d7e027

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1528, 'name': 'Stanislaw Pitucha', 'email': 'viraptor@gmail.com', 'username': 'stanislaw-pitucha'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-04-09 12:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/jsonutils.py'], 'message': "Optimise to_primitive common cases

to_primitive included many checks that were executed before any usual
types have been checked. It's safe to reorder / duplicate the most
common ones. Especially built-in types can be checked before other
more complicated scenarios. This is important since to_primitive gets
called over a million times in usual test run and many more times in a
live environment.

This change strips around 4% of nova testing time on my machine and the
function itself is ~5x faster on average according to the profiler.

Change-Id: I71e0c06bbcc31793a1cdcebb36d4e3d8c5876f73
"}]
commit_message:
Optimise to_primitive common cases

to_primitive included many checks that were executed before any usual
types have been checked. It's safe to reorder / duplicate the most
common ones. Especially built-in types can be checked before other
more complicated scenarios. This is important since to_primitive gets
called over a million times in usual test run and many more times in a
live environment.

This change strips around 4% of nova testing time on my machine and the
function itself is ~5x faster on average according to the profiler.

Change-Id: I71e0c06bbcc31793a1cdcebb36d4e3d8c5876f73

commit_message:
Fix for Cisco plugin physical device config error

This patch fixes a bug with the Cisco plugin where subsequent vlan id's
would overwrite the existing trunking config on a switch interface.

Fixes: Bug #1161946

subject: Make "multi_host" True when it is setted 'T' in network_create
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-03-29 03:56:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': 'Make "multi_host" True when it is setted 'T' in network_create

Fixes bug 1161297
Even if creating a network with the "--multi_host=T", the "multi_host"
property of the new network is still "False".
This is because nova server interprets 'T' to "False".
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I26ff5139ad82f5c8b71d85fafec2b8aadd5f43ff
'}]
commit_message:
Make "multi_host" True when it is setted 'T' in network_create

Fixes bug 1161297
Even if creating a network with the "--multi_host=T", the "multi_host"
property of the new network is still "False".
This is because nova server interprets 'T' to "False".
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I26ff5139ad82f5c8b71d85fafec2b8aadd5f43ff

commit_message:
API extension for instance migration history

Adds a new API extenstion to access migration history
information for given instance.

Admins are frequently in need to access migration related
data and the only way to do this right now is to go to the
db. This extension attempts to solve that by providing a simple
way to list migration history for a given instance.

Implements blueprint bp-migration-history-ext
DocImpact

Change-Id: I43e30e84dda07448d5deef6a6983569f687aa4e5

subject: Move auth info api-paste.ini -> nova.conf.sample
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-03-28 02:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'etc/nova/api-paste.ini', 'tools/conf/extract_opts.py', 'tools/conf/generate_sample.sh'], 'message': 'Move auth info api-paste.ini -> nova.conf.sample

Move keystone authentication fields from etc/nova/api-paste.ini to
etc/nova/nova.conf.sample.

It is easier on operators if only the nova.conf file needs to be
edited, and seeing this content in etc/nova/api-paste.ini is
confusing.

Modified tools/conf/extract_opts.py to support module name as a
command-line argument, since the keystone auth options are defined
in the keystoneclient module.

Modified tools/conf/generate_sample.sh to pass the relevant module
name that contains the keystone_auth parameters:
"keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

Fixes bug 1161165

Change-Id: I805160cd4089cb220ff64158e5bb44eeb9413ced
'}]
commit_message:
Move auth info api-paste.ini -> nova.conf.sample

Move keystone authentication fields from etc/nova/api-paste.ini to
etc/nova/nova.conf.sample.

It is easier on operators if only the nova.conf file needs to be
edited, and seeing this content in etc/nova/api-paste.ini is
confusing.

Modified tools/conf/extract_opts.py to support module name as a
command-line argument, since the keystone auth options are defined
in the keystoneclient module.

Modified tools/conf/generate_sample.sh to pass the relevant module
name that contains the keystone_auth parameters:
"keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

Fixes bug 1161165

Change-Id: I805160cd4089cb220ff64158e5bb44eeb9413ced

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-03-29 23:20:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Start to hide the usage of greenthread.sleep in compute.manager.

Instead of exposing the inner details of greenthread in for loops
we should attempt to start to remove said special cases and hide our
usage of greenthreads (between each iteration for yielding purposes) so
that later in the future it becomes easier to change the leaky greenthread
abstraction.

Fixes: bug 1161965
Implements: blueprint hide-greenthreads

Change-Id: I466e0816d2fcffd48202fc300bc5c9e865733398
'}]
commit_message:
Start to hide the usage of greenthread.sleep in compute.manager.

Instead of exposing the inner details of greenthread in for loops
we should attempt to start to remove said special cases and hide our
usage of greenthreads (between each iteration for yielding purposes) so
that later in the future it becomes easier to change the leaky greenthread
abstraction.

Fixes: bug 1161965
Implements: blueprint hide-greenthreads

Change-Id: I466e0816d2fcffd48202fc300bc5c9e865733398

commit_message:
Add support for volume backup-to-swift

Matches support recently submitted to cinder.

Adds the commands: list-backup, show-backup, create-backup and
delete-backup to both v1 and v2 api versions, since extentions
are available to both.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6760, 'name': 'Mitsuhiko Yamazaki', 'email': 'yamazaki-mitsuhiko@cnt.mxc.nes.nec.co.jp', 'username': 'ymzk37'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-08 03:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/coverage_ext.py', 'doc/api_samples/os-coverage/coverage-reset-post-req.json', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_coverage_ext.py', 'doc/api_samples/os-coverage/coverage-reset-post-req.xml'], 'message': 'Add reset function to nova coverage.

Now nova coverage is standardized to accumulate coverage data.
It enables user to get combined coverage data of several tests.
In addition to it, we need to restart nova services when measuring
coverage of each test because there is no function to reset data.
This adds reset coverage data API.

Fixes bug: 1164331

Change-Id: Idd16cf3849b6510e7c620ed3bf16d507ed44c328
'}]
commit_message:
Add reset function to nova coverage.

Now nova coverage is standardized to accumulate coverage data.
It enables user to get combined coverage data of several tests.
In addition to it, we need to restart nova services when measuring
coverage of each test because there is no function to reset data.
This adds reset coverage data API.

Fixes bug: 1164331

Change-Id: Idd16cf3849b6510e7c620ed3bf16d507ed44c328

commit_message:
Remove nova-vm element.

nova-vm element has become out of date with the
rest of the tripleo system.

It should be replaced by specifying libvirt to the
os-config-applier-able 'nova' element.

Change-Id: I147f5a536ca40f63b2c43b72ea2678c570516215

commit_message:
Small change to exception handling in swift store

Tweak the exception handling when deleting stale chunks from the swift
backend so we don't need to use the sys module or stash the exception.

Addresses bug 1158342.

commit_message:
Remove quantum-api element, for now.

quantum-api element is out of date.

While services will need to break up services soon,
in this case it should be done by depending on 'quantum'
element, and having quantum-api element just drop a
service-start script.

Change-Id: Idbcab2266c40aff0129d5bd4cfa1295571ec8165

commit_message:
Add an extension to show the network id of a virtual interface

This extension adds the OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id param
so that users can determine vif plunged into which network now.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I56bef5c45f7f545aa5e9b13760dff1c802da0f8f
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Expands the Boot from Volume documentation.

This commit adds some further information about booting from volumes. It
ensures the features are updated for Grizzly. Also removes a duplicate
section about booting from volumes. Also updates the Ops Guide with this
info.

Change-Id: Iac6a4caa36da388936543c7a3aaed3af1429bdd0
Fixes: bug #1163580

subject: xenapi: /boot/guest should point to local SR
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-04-03 14:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['tools/xen/functions', 'tools/xen/mocks', 'tools/xen/test_functions.sh'], 'message': "xenapi: /boot/guest should point to local SR

Fixes bug 1037516

This patch creates a directory os-guest-kernels inside the local SR, and
sets up /boot/guest to be a symlink to that directory. This way
OpenStack won't pollute Dom0's filesystem.

Change-Id: If8dfe24355bd782a401fed0f2c4b423efd9c11ba
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: /boot/guest should point to local SR

Fixes bug 1037516

This patch creates a directory os-guest-kernels inside the local SR, and
sets up /boot/guest to be a symlink to that directory. This way
OpenStack won't pollute Dom0's filesystem.

Change-Id: If8dfe24355bd782a401fed0f2c4b423efd9c11ba

commit_message:
Enable automatic validation of many HACKING rules.

 * Add hacking to the tox build - a set of flake8 plugins that
   perform automatic validation of many HACKING.rst rules.
 * This patch configures hacking in the tox build and performs
   the mechanical cleanup required to allow the checks to pass.
 * See https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hacking

Change-Id: Ib41313b5aae991e6ffef2a89dd69e83985bdc36d

subject: Correct a unit test failure that crept into trunk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-08 21:38:21.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Correct a unit test failure that crept into trunk

At some point, the "nova list" command started returning an
empty table when no results were obtained, while the
tests.test_shell.ShellTest.test_password test was expecting
a single newline.  Whichever commit caused this change in
behavior somehow made it past the gate without forcing the
test to be updated.

This commit fixes the issue by changing the output that
test_shell.test_password is expecting.

Fixes bug 1166464.

Change-Id: I57636b4a1e525c440925caba0bbb51bbcd94b080
'}]
commit_message:
Correct a unit test failure that crept into trunk

At some point, the "nova list" command started returning an
empty table when no results were obtained, while the
tests.test_shell.ShellTest.test_password test was expecting
a single newline.  Whichever commit caused this change in
behavior somehow made it past the gate without forcing the
test to be updated.

This commit fixes the issue by changing the output that
test_shell.test_password is expecting.

Fixes bug 1166464.

Change-Id: I57636b4a1e525c440925caba0bbb51bbcd94b080

commit_message:
Don't try to smart find packages that aren't there.

We help out by looking for the obvious stuff. But sometimee, like in
git-review, we don't have a package at all.

Change-Id: Ic575c0008c69ffaba43a637b460899dd848d3fd5
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/26289
Reviewed-by: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>

Tested-by: Jenkins

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-08 10:44:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Attempt to delete resources even if they failed

commit_message:
Attempt to delete resources even if they failed

To do otherwise risks leaving resources silently running that exist but
have experienced some kind of error during creation.

Fixes bug 1165023

Change-Id: Ie60fb053b1a596d102ca1b6a8429dd50ed41ff92

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-08 10:44:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/user.py', 'heat/tests/test_user.py'], 'message': 'Fix AccessKey deletion with bad credentials

If an AccessKey could not be created, it also could not be deleted. This
change allows deletion of the resource to proceed even if the user does not
exist.

Fixes bug 1155824

Also fixes a bug that the actual key would never be deleted, because the
resource_id is set to None beforehand.

Change-Id: I34886410e3e25ad62e4eba537063f922b011e25a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AccessKey deletion with bad credentials

If an AccessKey could not be created, it also could not be deleted. This
change allows deletion of the resource to proceed even if the user does not
exist.

Fixes bug 1155824

Also fixes a bug that the actual key would never be deleted, because the
resource_id is set to None beforehand.

Change-Id: I34886410e3e25ad62e4eba537063f922b011e25a

subject: Fix xml request doesn't work with unicode
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-04-08 22:10:14.000000000', 'files': ['quantumclient/v2_0/client.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_nvp_queue.py', 'quantumclient/shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_port.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_securitygroup.py', 'quantumclient/client.py', 'quantumclient/common/utils.py', 'quantumclient/openstack/common/strutils.py', 'tests/unit/lb/test_cli20_pool.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_subnet.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_network.py', 'quantumclient/common/serializer.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20.py', 'quantumclient/common/constants.py', 'tests/unit/lb/test_cli20_healthmonitor.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_floatingips.py', 'tests/unit/lb/test_cli20_member.py', 'tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'openstack-common.conf', 'quantumclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_nvpnetworkgateway.py', 'tests/unit/lb/test_cli20_vip.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_router.py'], 'message': "Fix xml request doesn't work with unicode

Fix bug 1160704

* httplib2 doesn't work with unicode url and params. So encode all unicode
to utf-8 before request.
* Fix xml serializer doesn't work with unicode
* Decode command argument to unicode in main function
* Exception's message maybe include unicode, decode message to unicode
before logging or print.
* Sync the changing of serializer/deserilizer's code with quantum server code
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25482/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25046/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21410/
* Enable xml test

Change-Id: Ib140e34d54cc916e2ea172e4bad9e4a77388723a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix xml request doesn't work with unicode

Fix bug 1160704

* httplib2 doesn't work with unicode url and params. So encode all unicode
to utf-8 before request.
* Fix xml serializer doesn't work with unicode
* Decode command argument to unicode in main function
* Exception's message maybe include unicode, decode message to unicode
before logging or print.
* Sync the changing of serializer/deserilizer's code with quantum server code
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25482/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25046/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21410/
* Enable xml test

Change-Id: Ib140e34d54cc916e2ea172e4bad9e4a77388723a

subject: RestClient:keystone_auth hides requests and errors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-03 14:07:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'message': "RestClient:keystone_auth hides requests and errors

RestClient::keystone_auth did not logged requests/responses and instead
 of reporting unexpected status codes it silently returned None.
(Which causes 'NoneType is not iterrable' for example for HTTP 500)

Also removed setting of unused variable tenant_id.

Change-Id: I60e074a1180aca89006cc6c6345a2288b125540f
"}]
commit_message:
RestClient:keystone_auth hides requests and errors

RestClient::keystone_auth did not logged requests/responses and instead
 of reporting unexpected status codes it silently returned None.
(Which causes 'NoneType is not iterrable' for example for HTTP 500)

Also removed setting of unused variable tenant_id.

Change-Id: I60e074a1180aca89006cc6c6345a2288b125540f

subject: Add testresources and testscenarios.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-04-07 06:07:27.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-requires'], 'message': "Add testresources and testscenarios.

Now that we're on testtools/testr in places, we can start using
testresources and testscenarios to optimize our test suites a bit.

testresources allows for declarative fixture creation in such a way that
an optimizing test suite can group tests that need an expensive-to-set-up
fixture together and use a reset method on the fixture between tests.

testscenarios allows for declarations of combinations of inputs and outputs
to a single tests, which can greatly simplify large amounts of repetitive
code that's trying to grab coverage of option sets.

Change-Id: I834813071c519086f06f80bf418c949bbc47c0ab
"}]
commit_message:
Add testresources and testscenarios.

Now that we're on testtools/testr in places, we can start using
testresources and testscenarios to optimize our test suites a bit.

testresources allows for declarative fixture creation in such a way that
an optimizing test suite can group tests that need an expensive-to-set-up
fixture together and use a reset method on the fixture between tests.

testscenarios allows for declarations of combinations of inputs and outputs
to a single tests, which can greatly simplify large amounts of repetitive
code that's trying to grab coverage of option sets.

Change-Id: I834813071c519086f06f80bf418c949bbc47c0ab

commit_message:
Refactoring of base test case classes

* Splits out the "manager" class into its own file (at least
  for now to keep the code change size down initially)
* Adds base manager classes for Fuzz and Default clients
* Adds base test case class and a derived base SmokeTest class
* Adds smoke test for basic server operations in compute
* Adds non-smoke test for advanced server operations in compute

Change-Id: Ib87da825f05550d625a08aa1fe82bfaa921e80f9

commit_message:
Fix typo for run_tests.sh -S option

This patch fixes a typo of getopt's arguments. If the second 's' option letter
is not 'S', -S option is not recognized.

Fix bug 1161921

Change-Id: I0b5a372e7257b9319b350131303c1a9f51b57eb5

subject: Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 191, 'name': 'Trey Morris', 'email': 'trey.morris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tr3buchet'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1525, 'name': 'Rafi Khardalian', 'email': 'rafi@metacloud.com', 'username': 'rkhardalian'}, {'_account_id': 1970, 'name': 'Jacob Wen', 'email': 'wenjianhn@gmail.com', 'username': 'wenjianhn'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5174, 'name': 'Mauro Rodrigues', 'email': 'maurosr@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'maurosr'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-01-16 21:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.

If the call to the driver to resume an instance raises an exception,
then nova-compute fails to start properly. This can happen during
recovery, for example, where an instance has been deleted so the
backing files are gone but the database is restored to a state
where it exists.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and setting
the instance to error.

Fixes bug 1100430

Change-Id: Ie31f39fcd43174c29bf7a5cb1b6fa29e4c723f97
"}]
commit_message:
Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.

If the call to the driver to resume an instance raises an exception,
then nova-compute fails to start properly. This can happen during
recovery, for example, where an instance has been deleted so the
backing files are gone but the database is restored to a state
where it exists.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and setting
the instance to error.

Fixes bug 1100430

Change-Id: Ie31f39fcd43174c29bf7a5cb1b6fa29e4c723f97

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a

Change-Id: I2b5c56dbf941b272bd89b0dbe6f651196d90944f

commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I2b5c56dbf941b272bd89b0dbe6f651196d90944f

subject: Allow users to create a rich network topology
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-03-25 01:42:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/templates/routers/ports/_create.html', 'openstack_dashboard/api/quantum.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/forms.py'], 'message': 'Allow users to create a rich network topology

Fixes bug 1146926

This commit enables Quantum Router support to create a router
interface with a specified IP address. Previously we can connect
one network (subnet) to only one router and a topology we can create
is limited. By this commit we can connect one network to multiple
routers and create a rich network topology through Dashboard.

This commit also fixes the folowing bugs:
* subnet_id in "Add Interface" form and network_id in "Set Gateway"
  form should be required=True since they are required fields.
* An error message is display twice when the above two forms.

Change-Id: Ifb90f70a4468fdf4e8ba356080cd0333f10e595f
'}]
commit_message:
Allow users to create a rich network topology

Fixes bug 1146926

This commit enables Quantum Router support to create a router
interface with a specified IP address. Previously we can connect
one network (subnet) to only one router and a topology we can create
is limited. By this commit we can connect one network to multiple
routers and create a rich network topology through Dashboard.

This commit also fixes the folowing bugs:
* subnet_id in "Add Interface" form and network_id in "Set Gateway"
  form should be required=True since they are required fields.
* An error message is display twice when the above two forms.

Change-Id: Ifb90f70a4468fdf4e8ba356080cd0333f10e595f

commit_message:
refactor _get_sync_routers to use get_routers.

By using get_routers, get_sync_data() can get all attributes
including attributes provided by extensions which extend router ext.

Change-Id: I4be761dadd18eed19f4e54676e77d99bcc4a4745

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-04-02 12:02:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Fix processing of filters when listing instances

The method for listing of instances maps request filter names to
correct attribute names of DB models. Both "project_id" (one that
is equal to the id of a tenant that makes a request) and "tenant_id"
(one that is used for filtering of instances which belong to the given
tenant) filters map to the same entry in the resulting filters dict, so
one of them will eventually be overwritten. Ensure we have only one
of these filters.

Fixes bug 1134382.

Change-Id: Ic391ff5f8b073f00284aabeafee3d5ec53744309
'}]
commit_message:
Fix processing of filters when listing instances

The method for listing of instances maps request filter names to
correct attribute names of DB models. Both "project_id" (one that
is equal to the id of a tenant that makes a request) and "tenant_id"
(one that is used for filtering of instances which belong to the given
tenant) filters map to the same entry in the resulting filters dict, so
one of them will eventually be overwritten. Ensure we have only one
of these filters.

Fixes bug 1134382.

Change-Id: Ic391ff5f8b073f00284aabeafee3d5ec53744309

subject: Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-05 14:04:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': "Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error

Don't see any reason to construct a list for request_spec['volume_id'].
And it indeed causes problems when the scheduler receives a reschedule
request with such a request_spec.

Fixes bug #1164857

Change-Id: I811e957d5bf9c814165d55ea0042833ea72c8de5
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error

Don't see any reason to construct a list for request_spec['volume_id'].
And it indeed causes problems when the scheduler receives a reschedule
request with such a request_spec.

Fixes bug #1164857

Change-Id: I811e957d5bf9c814165d55ea0042833ea72c8de5

commit_message:
leave re-scheduled volume status to creating

A re-scheduled volume should not be exported and set to available

Fixes bug #1159027

Change-Id: Ie61d9132ce1bd6461d5e4d9836424ebf14100389
